title: Honoring Earl Lilley upon the occasion of his retirement after 51 years of distinguished service as Chief Clerk in the Sullivan County Clerk's Office
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring  Earl  Lilley upon the occasion of his
retirement after 51 years of distinguished service as Chief Clerk in the
Sullivan County Clerk's Office

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative  Body  to  acknowledge  the
significant  milestones  in  the distinguished careers of esteemed resi-
dents of this noble Empire State; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to honor Earl
Lilley  upon  the  occasion  of his retirement after 51 years of distin-
guished service to the Sullivan County Clerk's Office; and
  WHEREAS, Earl Lilley, a lifelong resident of Bethel, New York, started
his career at the Sullivan County Court  House  in  the  County  Clerk's
Office in 1959; nine years later he accepted a position as Special Court
Clerk,  before  ultimately obtaining the title of Chief Clerk of Supreme
and County Courts in 1977, where he remained  until  his  retirement  in
2010; and
  WHEREAS, For the past 51 years, Earl Lilley rendered faithful, consci-
entious  and  valuable  service  to  the Sullivan County Clerk's Office,
earning the admiration, esteem and affection of his colleagues; and
  WHEREAS, In his capacity as Chief Clerk of Supreme and County  Courts,
Earl Lilley served with loyalty, honor and distinction, and was governed
by  a keen sense of duty and always showed a unique grasp of human prob-
lems in his official acts; and
  WHEREAS, Earl has been blessed with his loving wife of 43 years, Shar-
on, and their three wonderful children, Lynn, Louis and the  late  Lisa,
as  well  as  six adoring grandchildren, Anna Jane, Nicole, Amanda, Ben,
Jacob and Jonah, all of whom feel privileged to be part of his life  and
rejoice in his achievements; and
  WHEREAS,  Upon  retirement,  Earl  looks forward to spending more time
with his wife, children, and grandchildren; he also plans to devote more
time to traveling, gardening, square dancing and country music; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that  when  individ-
uals  of  such  noble aims and accomplishments are brought to our atten-
tion, they should be celebrated and recognized by all  the  citizens  of
the great State of New York; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Earl Lilley upon the occasion of his retirement after 51 years  of
distinguished  service  to  Sullivan  County  Clerk's  Office; and be it
further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Earl Lilley, Monticello, New York.
